summary: This document is a search warrant issued by the Circuit Court of the Fifteenth Judicial Circuit in Palm Beach County, Florida, authorizing the search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence at 358 El Brillo Road. The warrant details the items to be seized, including computers, photographs, and any evidence related to sexual activity with minors. The warrant was signed by Judge Laura Johnson and is subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Joseph Recarey
persons.context: Detective Joseph Recarey is the affiant who signed the affidavit supporting the search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's residence.

persons.name: Laura Johnson
persons.context: Judge Laura Johnson issued the order sealing the affidavit and application for the search warrant.

persons.name: Daliah Weiss
persons.context: Daliah Weiss is mentioned as being copied on the order sealing the search warrant and affidavit.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the subject of the search warrant, with evidence related to illegal activities being sought from his residence.

connections.description: Detective Joseph Recarey presented the affidavit for the search warrant to Judge Laura Johnson, who approved it.
Detective Joseph Recarey is investigating Jeffrey Epstein in relation to the allegations of illegal activities.
Daliah Weiss, as an Assistant State Attorney, is involved in the legal proceedings overseen by Judge Laura Johnson.

events.title: Issuance of Search Warrant
events.description: A search warrant was issued for Jeffrey Epstein's residence based on an affidavit presented by Detective Joseph Recarey.

events.title: Sealing of Search Warrant
events.description: The search warrant and related affidavit were sealed by Judge Laura Johnson, restricting access to the documents.

locations: 358 El Brillo Road, Palm Beach, Florida 33480
keyFacts: The search warrant was issued on October 18, 2005, and signed on October 19, 2005.
The warrant authorized the search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence for evidence related to sexual activity with minors.
The affidavit and application for the search warrant were sealed by the court, limiting public access to the details.
Detective Joseph Recarey is the primary investigator associated with the search warrant.
Judge Laura Johnson presided over the issuance and sealing of the search warrant.
